result.execSummary:
The defendant Jolene E Spaude was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA and follow up;

Counseling/treatment as recommended.

DNA sample.

Parties agree to the forfeiture of the items/money ($628.00 that was seized) as stated in the criminal complaint.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jolene E Spaude

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 9:21 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person for ADA Sid Brubacher.
Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Dan Cveykus in person.
Preliminary Hearing:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

Plea Hearing:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Repeater)>> 5 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 3 Years ES. CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, Counseling/Treatment as recommended, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 60 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP. 

Parties agree to the forfeiture of the items/money ($628.00 that was seized) as stated in the Criminal Complaint. 

Adjourned: 9:39 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Pre-trial conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): L.M.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
